meanings.definition: Having a lid or covering that can be opened or closed.
meanings.sent1: The operculate box kept the cookies fresh.
meanings.sent2: The jar had an operculate lid that could be easily lifted.
meanings.sent3: The operculate umbrella protected her from the rain.
meanings.sent4: His operculate backpack shielded his belongings from the elements.
meanings.sent5: The operculate book cover kept the pages safe from damage.

meanings.definition: To close or cover with a lid or operculum.
meanings.sent1: She operculated the jar tightly to keep the contents fresh.
meanings.sent2: He operculates the bottle before storing it in the fridge.
meanings.sent3: The chef operculated the pot to simmer the soup.
meanings.sent4: The gardener operculates the seedlings to protect them from pests.
meanings.sent5: The scientist operculates the petri dish to observe bacterial growth.
